2. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column8: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column10: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.

column2: 3. When passing another vehicle:
column4: pass the vehicle as safely and as quickly as possible.
column6: honk your horn repeatedly to warn the other driver.
column8: there is no need to signal.
column10: you can exceed the posted speed limit.

column2: 4. A yellow arrow means:
column4: The same as a steady yellow light.
column6: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column8: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 5. When you see a flashing red ball, you should:
column4: proceed as if it were a stop sign.
column6: look in all directions for approaching traffic and pedestrians and proceed only when it is safe to do so.

7. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

column2: 8. You are coming to an intersection and have a green light. Pedestrians are crossing against the red. You should:
column4: claim your right-of-way and proceed with caution.

column10: stop to let pedestrians cross safely.

column2: 9. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column10: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 12. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:

column6: you should give yourself additional time to stop.
column8: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.

16. Drivers should you consider driving around a railroad crossing gate that is going down:

column2: 17. If two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop at the same time:
column6: the vehicle on the left must yield to the vehicle on the right.

column2: 18. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
